definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: This has created an unexpectedly profitable market for Roshan.
sentences.chinese: 這爲羅山帶來了出乎意料的贏利市場。

sentences.english: The result is quite a shocker but I am not surprised.
sentences.chinese: 結果是有點出乎意料，但我卻不太喫驚。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, the craft crashed when it was landing.
sentences.chinese: 出乎意料地，飛船在着陸的時候撞壞了。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, someone in our family was admitted to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 但出乎意料的是，家裏有人生病住進了醫院。

sentences.english: The president's death had unexpected repercussion.
sentences.chinese: 總統的逝世引起出乎意料的反響。

sentences.english: Afternoon, the military theory courses are also unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 下午，軍事理論課也出乎意料。

sentences.english: A little unexpected decoration goes a long way in cheering up passerby.
sentences.chinese: 一小點出乎意料的裝飾將會引起路人一長串的歡呼。

sentences.english: The season finale is taking shape now and it’s going to be quite a surprise.
sentences.chinese: 這季的最後一集現在已經基本成形了，相當出乎意料。

sentences.english: Harris said the gender of the viewer influenced reactions, a somewhat surprising result.
sentences.chinese: 哈里斯說出乎意料的是觀影者的性別會影響反應。

sentences.english: Then all of a sudden the first stars began to shine.
sentences.chinese: 然後，出乎意料地，第一顆星星開始閃耀了。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, Cabell was one of those who put things back on track.
sentences.chinese: 出乎意料的是，卡貝爾成了那個把一切拉回正軌的人。

sentences.english: Out of the blue, Cicoria got this sudden, insatiable urge to listen to piano music.
sentences.chinese: 出乎意料地，西科里拉突然無休止地渴望聽鋼琴音樂。

sentences.english: DPT spokesman Palden Tshering says no one expected such a landslide.
sentences.chinese: 該黨發言人希林表示，這很出乎意料。

sentences.english: A fierce storm came out of leftfield and surprised everyone.
sentences.chinese: 一場出乎意料的猛烈暴風雨讓許多人吃了一驚。

sentences.english: Bluetongue appeared out of the blue. And that could happen again.
sentences.chinese: 藍舌病的出現出乎意料，並可能再次發生。

sentences.english: Membership of the club has ballooned beyond all expectations.
sentences.chinese: 該俱樂部會員人數出乎意料地激增了。

definition: due to/to stem from/to go beyond (also fig. beyond reason, expectations etc)/to go against (expectations)
to come as no surprise/as expected
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
unexpected/hard to imagine/it had not occurred to me/who could have thought that
